            <h2 class="Box-title">
              <a href="#readme" data-view-component="true" class="Link--primary">README.md</a>
            </h2>
          </div>
        </div>

          <div data-target="readme-toc.content" class="Box-body px-5 pb-5">
            <article class="markdown-body entry-content container-lg" itemprop="text"><h1 dir="auto"><a id="user-content-typhoeus----" class="anchor" aria-hidden="true" href="#typhoeus----"><svg class="octicon octicon-link" viewBox="0 0 16 16" version="1.1" width="16" height="16" aria-hidden="true"><path fill-rule="evenodd" d="M7.775 3.275a.75.75 0 001.06 1.06l1.25-1.25a2 2 0 112.83 2.83l-2.5 2.5a2 2 0 01-2.83 0 .75.75 0 00-1.06 1.06 3.5 3.5 0 004.95 0l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 00-4.95-4.95l-1.25 1.25zm-4.69 9.64a2 2 0 010-2.83l2.5-2.5a2 2 0 012.83 0 .75.75 0 001.06-1.06 3.5 3.5 0 00-4.95 0l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 004.95 4.95l1.25-1.25a.75.75 0 00-1.06-1.06l-1.25 1.25a2 2 0 01-2.83 0z"></path></svg></a>Typhoeus <a href="https://github.com/typhoeus/typhoeus/actions/workflows/ci.yml"><img src="https://github.com/typhoeus/typhoeus/actions/workflows/ci.yml/badge.svg" alt="CI" style="max-width: 100%;"></a> <a href="https://github.com/typhoeus/typhoeus/actions/workflows/experimental.yml"><img src="https://github.com/typhoeus/typhoeus/actions/workflows/experimental.yml/badge.svg" alt="Experimental" style="max-width: 100%;"></a> <a href="https://codeclimate.com/github/typhoeus/typhoeus" rel="nofollow"><img src="https://camo.githubusercontent.com/34e45c2cb368d2afe308a4262d706e3ef49d87ce63a8b33c32f16cc77d03bad5/68747470733a2f2f696d672e736869656c64732e696f2f636f6465636c696d6174652f6d61696e7461696e6162696c6974792f747970686f6575732f747970686f6575732e737667" alt="Code Climate" data-canonical-src="https://img.shields.io/codeclimate/maintainability/typhoeus/typhoeus.svg" style="max-width: 100%;"></a> <a href="https://rubygems.org/gems/typhoeus" rel="nofollow"><img src="https://camo.githubusercontent.com/d862e6c0ea65e691d6db12bcecc8ac9231474be037368c427165705638300519/68747470733a2f2f696d672e736869656c64732e696f2f67656d2f762f747970686f6575732e737667" alt="Gem Version" data-canonical-src="https://img.shields.io/gem/v/typhoeus.svg" style="max-width: 100%;"></a></h1>
<p dir="auto">Like a modern code version of the mythical beast with 100 serpent heads, Typhoeus runs HTTP requests in parallel while cleanly encapsulating handling logic.</p>
<h2 dir="auto"><a id="user-content-example" class="anchor" aria-hidden="true" href="#example"><svg class="octicon octicon-link" viewBox="0 0 16 16" version="1.1" width="16" height="16" aria-hidden="true"><path fill-rule="evenodd" d="M7.775 3.275a.75.75 0 001.06 1.06l1.25-1.25a2 2 0 112.83 2.83l-2.5 2.5a2 2 0 01-2.83 0 .75.75 0 00-1.06 1.06 3.5 3.5 0 004.95 0l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 00-4.95-4.95l-1.25 1.25zm-4.69 9.64a2 2 0 010-2.83l2.5-2.5a2 2 0 012.83 0 .75.75 0 001.06-1.06 3.5 3.5 0 00-4.95 0l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 004.95 4.95l1.25-1.25a.75.75 0 00-1.06-1.06l-1.25 1.25a2 2 0 01-2.83 0z"></path></svg></a>Example</h2>
<p dir="auto">A single request:</p>
<div class="highlight highlight-source-ruby notranslate position-relative overflow-auto" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content="Typhoeus.get("www.example.com", followlocation: true)"><pre><span class="pl-v">Typhoeus</span><span class="pl-kos">.</span><span class="pl-en">get</span><span class="pl-kos">(</span><span class="pl-s">"www.example.com"</span><span class="pl-kos">,</span> <span class="pl-pds">followlocation</span>: <span class="pl-c1">true</span><span class="pl-kos">)</span></pre></div>
<p dir="auto">Parallel requests:</p>
<div class="highlight highlight-source-ruby notranslate position-relative overflow-auto" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content="hydra = Typhoeus::Hydra.new
10.times.map{ hydra.queue(Typhoeus::Request.new("www.example.com", followlocation: true)) }
hydra.run"><pre><span class="pl-s1">hydra</span> <span class="pl-c1">=</span> <span class="pl-v">Typhoeus</span>::<span class="pl-v">Hydra</span><span class="pl-kos">.</span><span class="pl-en">new</span>
<span class="pl-c1">10</span><span class="pl-kos">.</span><span class="pl-en">times</span><span class="pl-kos">.</span><span class="pl-en">map</span><span class="pl-kos">{</span> <span class="pl-s1">hydra</span><span class="pl-kos">.</span><span class="pl-en">queue</span><span class="pl-kos">(</span><span class="pl-v">Typhoeus</span>::<span class="pl-v">Request</span><span class="pl-kos">.</span><span class="pl-en">new</span><span class="pl-kos">(</span><span class="pl-s">"www.example.com"</span><span class="pl-kos">,</span> <span class="pl-pds">followlocation</span>: <span class="pl-c1">true</span><span class="pl-kos">)</span><span class="pl-kos">)</span> <span class="pl-kos">}</span>
<span class="pl-s1">hydra</span><span class="pl-kos">.</span><span class="pl-en">run</span></pre></div>
<h2 dir="auto"><a id="user-content-installation" class="anchor" aria-hidden="true" href="#installation"><svg class="octicon octicon-link" viewBox="0 0 16 16" version="1.1" width="16" height="16" aria-hidden="true"><path fill-rule="evenodd" d="M7.775 3.275a.75.75 0 001.06 1.06l1.25-1.25a2 2 0 112.83 2.83l-2.5 2.5a2 2 0 01-2.83 0 .75.75 0 00-1.06 1.06 3.5 3.5 0 004.95 0l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 00-4.95-4.95l-1.25 1.25zm-4.69 9.64a2 2 0 010-2.83l2.5-2.5a2 2 0 012.83 0 .75.75 0 001.06-1.06 3.5 3.5 0 00-4.95 0l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 004.95 4.95l1.25-1.25a.75.75 0 00-1.06-1.06l-1.25 1.25a2 2 0 01-2.83 0z"></path></svg></a>Installation</h2>
<p dir="auto">Run:</p>
<div class="snippet-clipboard-content notranslate position-relative overflow-auto" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content="bundle add typhoeus"><pre class="notranslate"><code>bundle add typhoeus
</code></pre></div>
<p dir="auto">Or install it yourself as:</p>
<div class="snippet-clipboard-content notranslate position-relative overflow-auto" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content="gem install typhoeus"><pre class="notranslate"><code>gem install typhoeus
</code></pre></div>
<h2 dir="auto"><a id="user-content-project-tracking" class="anchor" aria-hidden="true" href="#project-tracking"><svg class="octicon octicon-link" viewBox="0 0 16 16" version="1.1" width="16" height="16" aria-hidden="true"><path fill-rule="evenodd" d="M7.775 3.275a.75.75 0 001.06 1.06l1.25-1.25a2 2 0 112.83 2.83l-2.5 2.5a2 2 0 01-2.83 0 .75.75 0 00-1.06 1.06 3.5 3.5 0 004.95 0l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 00-4.95-4.95l-1.25 1.25zm-4.69 9.64a2 2 0 010-2.83l2.5-2.5a2 2 0 012.83 0 .75.75 0 001.06-1.06 3.5 3.5 0 00-4.95 0l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 004.95 4.95l1.25-1.25a.75.75 0 00-1.06-1.06l-1.25 1.25a2 2 0 01-2.83 0z"></path></svg></a>Project Tracking</h2>
<ul dir="auto">
<li><a href="https://rubydoc.info/github/typhoeus/typhoeus/frames/Typhoeus" rel="nofollow">API Documentation</a> (GitHub master)</li>
</ul>
<h2 dir="auto"><a id="user-content-usage" class="anchor" aria-hidden="true" href="#usage"><svg class="octicon octicon-link" viewBox="0 0 16 16" version="1.1" width="16" height="16" aria-hidden="true"><path fill-rule="evenodd" d="M7.775 3.275a.75.75 0 001.06 1.06l1.25-1.25a2 2 0 112.83 2.83l-2.5 2.5a2 2 0 01-2.83 0 .75.75 0 00-1.06 1.06 3.5 3.5 0 004.95 0l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 00-4.95-4.95l-1.25 1.25zm-4.69 9.64a2 2 0 010-2.83l2.5-2.5a2 2 0 012.83 0 .75.75 0 001.06-1.06 3.5 3.5 0 00-4.95 0l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 004.95 4.95l1.25-1.25a.75.75 0 00-1.06-1.06l-1.25 1.25a2 2 0 01-2.83 0z"></path></svg></a>Usage</h2>
<h3 dir="auto"><a id="user-content-introduction" class="anchor" aria-hidden="true" href="#introduction"><svg class="octicon octicon-link" viewBox="0 0 16 16" version="1.1" width="16" height="16" aria-hidden="true"><path fill-rule="evenodd" d="M7.775 3.275a.75.75 0 001.06 1.06l1.25-1.25a2 2 0 112.83 2.83l-2.5 2.5a2 2 0 01-2.83 0 .75.75 0 00-1.06 1.06 3.5 3.5 0 004.95 0l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 00-4.95-4.95l-1.25 1.25zm-4.69 9.64a2 2 0 010-2.83l2.5-2.5a2 2 0 012.83 0 .75.75 0 001.06-1.06 3.5 3.5 0 00-4.95 0l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 004.95 4.95l1.25-1.25a.75.75 0 00-1.06-1.06l-1.25 1.25a2 2 0 01-2.83 0z"></path></svg></a>Introduction</h3>
<p dir="auto">The primary interface for Typhoeus is comprised of three classes: Request, Response, and Hydra. Request represents an HTTP request object, response represents an HTTP response, and Hydra manages making parallel HTTP connections.</p>
<div class="highlight highlight-source-ruby notranslate position-relative overflow-auto" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content="request = Typhoeus::Request.new(
  "www.example.com",
  method: :post,
  body: "this is a request body",
  params: { field1: "a field" },
  headers: { Accept: "text/html" }
)"><pre><span class="pl-s1">request</span> <span class="pl-c1">=</span> <span class="pl-v">Typhoeus</span>::<span class="pl-v">Request</span><span class="pl-kos">.</span><span class="pl-en">new</span><span class="pl-kos">(</span>
  <span class="pl-s">"www.example.com"</span><span class="pl-kos">,</span>
  <span class="pl-pds">method</span>: <span class="pl-pds">:post</span><span class="pl-kos">,</span>
  <span class="pl-pds">body</span>: <span class="pl-s">"this is a request body"</span><span class="pl-kos">,</span>
  <span class="pl-pds">params</span>: <span class="pl-kos">{</span> <span class="pl-pds">field1</span>: <span class="pl-s">"a field"</span> <span class="pl-kos">}</span><span class="pl-kos">,</span>
  <span class="pl-pds">headers</span>: <span class="pl-kos">{</span> <span class="pl-pds">Accept</span>: <span class="pl-s">"text/html"</span> <span class="pl-kos">}</span>
<span class="pl-kos">)</span></pre></div>
<p dir="auto">We can see from this that the first argument is the url. The second is a set of options.
The options are all optional. The default for <code>:method</code> is <code>:get</code>.</p>
<p dir="auto">When you want to send URL parameters, you can use <code>:params</code> hash to do so. Please note that in case of you should send a request via <code>x-www-form-urlencoded</code> parameters, you need to use <code>:body</code> hash instead. <code>params</code> are for URL parameters and <code>:body</code> is for the request body.</p>
<h4 dir="auto"><a id="user-content-sending-requests-through-the-proxy" class="anchor" aria-hidden="true" href="#sending-requests-through-the-proxy"><svg class="octicon octicon-link" viewBox="0 0 16 16" version="1.1" width="16" height="16" aria-hidden="true"><path fill-rule="evenodd" d="M7.775 3.275a.75.75 0 001.06 1.06l1.25-1.25a2 2 0 112.83 2.83l-2.5 2.5a2 2 0 01-2.83 0 .75.75 0 00-1.06 1.06 3.5 3.5 0 004.95 0l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 00-4.95-4.95l-1.25 1.25zm-4.69 9.64a2 2 0 010-2.83l2.5-2.5a2 2 0 012.83 0 .75.75 0 001.06-1.06 3.5 3.5 0 00-4.95 0l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 004.95 4.95l1.25-1.25a.75.75 0 00-1.06-1.06l-1.25 1.25a2 2 0 01-2.83 0z"></path></svg></a>Sending requests through the proxy</h4>
<p dir="auto">Add a proxy url to the list of options:</p>
<div class="highlight highlight-source-ruby notranslate position-relative overflow-auto" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content="options = {proxy: 'http://myproxy.org'}
req = Typhoeus::Request.new(url, options)"><pre><span class="pl-s1">options</span> <span class="pl-c1">=</span> <span class="pl-kos">{</span><span class="pl-pds">proxy</span>: <span class="pl-s">'http://myproxy.org'</span><span class="pl-kos">}</span>
<span class="pl-s1">req</span> <span class="pl-c1">=</span> <span class="pl-v">Typhoeus</span>::<span class="pl-v">Request</span><span class="pl-kos">.</span><span class="pl-en">new</span><span class="pl-kos">(</span><span class="pl-en">url</span><span class="pl-kos">,</span> <span class="pl-s1">options</span><span class="pl-kos">)</span></pre></div>
<p dir="auto">If your proxy requires authentication, add it with <code>proxyuserpwd</code> option key:</p>
<div class="highlight highlight-source-ruby notranslate position-relative overflow-auto" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content="options = {proxy: 'http://proxyurl.com', proxyuserpwd: 'user:password'}
req = Typhoeus::Request.new(url, options)"><pre><span class="pl-s1">options</span> <span class="pl-c1">=</span> <span class="pl-kos">{</span><span class="pl-pds">proxy</span>: <span class="pl-s">'http://proxyurl.com'</span><span class="pl-kos">,</span> <span class="pl-pds">proxyuserpwd</span>: <span class="pl-s">'user:password'</span><span class="pl-kos">}</span>
<span class="pl-s1">req</span> <span class="pl-c1">=</span> <span class="pl-v">Typhoeus</span>::<span class="pl-v">Request</span><span class="pl-kos">.</span><span class="pl-en">new</span><span class="pl-kos">(</span><span class="pl-en">url</span><span class="pl-kos">,</span> <span class="pl-s1">options</span><span class="pl-kos">)</span></pre></div>
<p dir="auto">Note that <code>proxyuserpwd</code> is a colon-separated username and password, in the vein of basic auth <code>userpwd</code> option.</p>
<p dir="auto">You can run the query either on its own or through the hydra:</p>
<div class="highlight highlight-source-ruby notranslate position-relative overflow-auto" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content="request.run
#=> <Typhoeus::Response ... >"><pre><span class="pl-en">request</span><span class="pl-kos">.</span><span class="pl-en">run</span>
<span class="pl-c">#=> <Typhoeus::Response ... ></span></pre></div>
<div class="highlight highlight-source-ruby notranslate position-relative overflow-auto" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content="hydra = Typhoeus::Hydra.hydra
hydra.queue(request)
hydra.run"><pre><span class="pl-s1">hydra</span> <span class="pl-c1">=</span> <span class="pl-v">Typhoeus</span>::<span class="pl-v">Hydra</span><span class="pl-kos">.</span><span class="pl-s1">hydra</span>
<span class="pl-s1">hydra</span><span class="pl-kos">.</span><span class="pl-en">queue</span><span class="pl-kos">(</span><span class="pl-en">request</span><span class="pl-kos">)</span>
<span class="pl-s1">hydra</span><span class="pl-kos">.</span><span class="pl-en">run</span></pre></div>
<p dir="auto">The response object will be set after the request is run.</p>
<div class="highlight highlight-source-ruby notranslate position-relative overflow-auto" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content="response = request.response
response.code
response.total_time
response.headers
response.body"><pre><span class="pl-s1">response</span> <span class="pl-c1">=</span> <span class="pl-en">request</span><span class="pl-kos">.</span><span class="pl-s1">response</span>
<span class="pl-s1">response</span><span class="pl-kos">.</span><span class="pl-en">code</span>
<span class="pl-s1">response</span><span class="pl-kos">.</span><span class="pl-en">total_time</span>
<span class="pl-s1">response</span><span class="pl-kos">.</span><span class="pl-en">headers</span>
<span class="pl-s1">response</span><span class="pl-kos">.</span><span class="pl-en">body</span></pre></div>
<h3 dir="auto"><a id="user-content-making-quick-requests" class="anchor" aria-hidden="true" href="#making-quick-requests"><svg class="octicon octicon-link" viewBox="0 0 16 16" version="1.1" width="16" height="16" aria-hidden="true"><path fill-rule="evenodd" d="M7.775 3.275a.75.75 0 001.06 1.06l1.25-1.25a2 2 0 112.83 2.83l-2.5 2.5a2 2 0 01-2.83 0 .75.75 0 00-1.06 1.06 3.5 3.5 0 004.95 0l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 00-4.95-4.95l-1.25 1.25zm-4.69 9.64a2 2 0 010-2.83l2.5-2.5a2 2 0 012.83 0 .75.75 0 001.06-1.06 3.5 3.5 0 00-4.95 0l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 004.95 4.95l1.25-1.25a.75.75 0 00-1.06-1.06l-1.25 1.25a2 2 0 01-2.83 0z"></path></svg></a>Making Quick Requests</h3>
<p dir="auto">Typhoeus has some convenience methods for performing single HTTP requests. The arguments are the same as those you pass into the request constructor.</p>
<div class="highlight highlight-source-ruby notranslate position-relative overflow-auto" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content="Typhoeus.get("www.example.com")
Typhoeus.head("www.example.com")
Typhoeus.put("www.example.com/posts/1", body: "whoo, a body")
Typhoeus.patch("www.example.com/posts/1", body: "a new body")
Typhoeus.post("www.example.com/posts", body: { title: "test post", content: "this is my test"})
Typhoeus.delete("www.example.com/posts/1")
Typhoeus.options("www.example.com")"><pre><span class="pl-v">Typhoeus</span><span class="pl-kos">.</span><span class="pl-en">get</span><span class="pl-kos">(</span><span class="pl-s">"www.example.com"</span><span class="pl-kos">)</span>
<span class="pl-v">Typhoeus</span><span class="pl-kos">.</span><span class="pl-en">head</span><span class="pl-kos">(</span><span class="pl-s">"www.example.com"</span><span class="pl-kos">)</span>
<span class="pl-v">Typhoeus</span><span class="pl-kos">.</span><span class="pl-en">put</span><span class="pl-kos">(</span><span class="pl-s">"www.example.com/posts/1"</span><span class="pl-kos">,</span> <span class="pl-pds">body</span>: <span class="pl-s">"whoo, a body"</span><span class="pl-kos">)</span>
<span class="pl-v">Typhoeus</span><span class="pl-kos">.</span><span class="pl-en">patch</span><span class="pl-kos">(</span><span class="pl-s">"www.example.com/posts/1"</span><span class="pl-kos">,</span> <span class="pl-pds">body</span>: <span class="pl-s">"a new body"</span><span class="pl-kos">)</span>
<span class="pl-v">Typhoeus</span><span class="pl-kos">.</span><span class="pl-en">post</span><span class="pl-kos">(</span><span class="pl-s">"www.example.com/posts"</span><span class="pl-kos">,</span> <span class="pl-pds">body</span>: <span class="pl-kos">{</span> <span class="pl-pds">title</span>: <span class="pl-s">"test post"</span><span class="pl-kos">,</span> <span class="pl-pds">content</span>: <span class="pl-s">"this is my test"</span><span class="pl-kos">}</span><span class="pl-kos">)</span>
<span class="pl-v">Typhoeus</span><span class="pl-kos">.</span><span class="pl-en">delete</span><span class="pl-kos">(</span><span class="pl-s">"www.example.com/posts/1"</span><span class="pl-kos">)</span>
<span class="pl-v">Typhoeus</span><span class="pl-kos">.</span><span class="pl-en">options</span><span class="pl-kos">(</span><span class="pl-s">"www.example.com"</span><span class="pl-kos">)</span></pre></div>
<h4 dir="auto"><a id="user-content-sending-params-in-the-body-with-put" class="anchor" aria-hidden="true" href="#sending-params-in-the-body-with-put"><svg class="octicon octicon-link" viewBox="0 0 16 16" version="1.1" width="16" height="16" aria-hidden="true"><path fill-rule="evenodd" d="M7.775 3.275a.75.75 0 001.06 1.06l1.25-1.25a2 2 0 112.83 2.83l-2.5 2.5a2 2 0 01-2.83 0 .75.75 0 00-1.06 1.06 3.5 3.5 0 004.95 0l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 00-4.95-4.95l-1.25 1.25zm-4.69 9.64a2 2 0 010-2.83l2.5-2.5a2 2 0 012.83 0 .75.75 0 001.06-1.06 3.5 3.5 0 00-4.95 0l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 004.95 4.95l1.25-1.25a.75.75 0 00-1.06-1.06l-1.25 1.25a2 2 0 01-2.83 0z"></path></svg></a>Sending params in the body with PUT</h4>
<p dir="auto">When using POST the content-type is set automatically to 'application/x-www-form-urlencoded'. That's not the case for any other method like PUT, PATCH, HEAD and so on,  irrespective of whether you are using body or not. To get the same result as POST, i.e. a hash in the body coming through as params in the receiver, you need to set the content-type as shown below:</p>
<div class="highlight highlight-source-ruby notranslate position-relative overflow-auto" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content="Typhoeus.put("www.example.com/posts/1",
        headers: {'Content-Type'=> "application/x-www-form-urlencoded"},
        body: {title:"test post updated title", content: "this is my updated content"}
    )"><pre><span class="pl-v">Typhoeus</span><span class="pl-kos">.</span><span class="pl-en">put</span><span class="pl-kos">(</span><span class="pl-s">"www.example.com/posts/1"</span><span class="pl-kos">,</span>
        <span class="pl-pds">headers</span>: <span class="pl-kos">{</span><span class="pl-s">'Content-Type'</span><span class="pl-c1">=></span> <span class="pl-s">"application/x-www-form-urlencoded"</span><span class="pl-kos">}</span><span class="pl-kos">,</span>
        <span class="pl-pds">body</span>: <span class="pl-kos">{</span><span class="pl-pds">title</span>:<span class="pl-s">"test post updated title"</span><span class="pl-kos">,</span> <span class="pl-pds">content</span>: <span class="pl-s">"this is my updated content"</span><span class="pl-kos">}</span>
    <span class="pl-kos">)</span></pre></div>
<h3 dir="auto"><a id="user-content-handling-http-errors" class="anchor" aria-hidden="true" href="#handling-http-errors"><svg class="octicon octicon-link" viewBox="0 0 16 16" version="1.1" width="16" height="16" aria-hidden="true"><path fill-rule="evenodd" d="M7.775 3.275a.75.75 0 001.06 1.06l1.25-1.25a2 2 0 112.83 2.83l-2.5 2.5a2 2 0 01-2.83 0 .75.75 0 00-1.06 1.06 3.5 3.5 0 004.95 0l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 00-4.95-4.95l-1.25 1.25zm-4.69 9.64a2 2 0 010-2.83l2.5-2.5a2 2 0 012.83 0 .75.75 0 001.06-1.06 3.5 3.5 0 00-4.95 0l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 004.95 4.95l1.25-1.25a.75.75 0 00-1.06-1.06l-1.25 1.25a2 2 0 01-2.83 0z"></path></svg></a>Handling HTTP errors</h3>
<p dir="auto">You can query the response object to figure out if you had a successful
request or not. Here’s some example code that you might use to handle errors.
The callbacks are executed right after the request is finished, make sure to define
them before running the request.</p>
<div class="highlight highlight-source-ruby notranslate position-relative overflow-auto" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content="request = Typhoeus::Request.new("www.example.com", followlocation: true)

request.on_complete do |response|
  if response.success?
    # hell yeah
  elsif response.timed_out?
    # aw hell no
    log("got a time out")
  elsif response.code == 0
    # Could not get an http response, something's wrong.
    log(response.return_message)
  else
    # Received a non-successful http response.
    log("HTTP request failed: " + response.code.to_s)
  end
end

request.run"><pre><span class="pl-s1">request</span> <span class="pl-c1">=</span> <span class="pl-v">Typhoeus</span>::<span class="pl-v">Request</span><span class="pl-kos">.</span><span class="pl-en">new</span><span class="pl-kos">(</span><span class="pl-s">"www.example.com"</span><span class="pl-kos">,</span> <span class="pl-pds">followlocation</span>: <span class="pl-c1">true</span><span class="pl-kos">)</span>

<span class="pl-s1">request</span><span class="pl-kos">.</span><span class="pl-en">on_complete</span> <span class="pl-k">do</span> |<span class="pl-s1">response</span>|
  <span class="pl-k">if</span> <span class="pl-s1">response</span><span class="pl-kos">.</span><span class="pl-en">success?</span>
    <span class="pl-c"># hell yeah</span>
  <span class="pl-k">elsif</span> <span class="pl-s1">response</span><span class="pl-kos">.</span><span class="pl-en">timed_out?</span>
    <span class="pl-c"># aw hell no</span>
    <span class="pl-en">log</span><span class="pl-kos">(</span><span class="pl-s">"got a time out"</span><span class="pl-kos">)</span>
  <span class="pl-k">elsif</span> <span class="pl-s1">response</span><span class="pl-kos">.</span><span class="pl-en">code</span> == <span class="pl-c1">0</span>
    <span class="pl-c"># Could not get an http response, something's wrong.</span>
    <span class="pl-en">log</span><span class="pl-kos">(</span><span class="pl-s1">response</span><span class="pl-kos">.</span><span class="pl-en">return_message</span><span class="pl-kos">)</span>
  <span class="pl-k">else</span>
    <span class="pl-c"># Received a non-successful http response.</span>
    <span class="pl-en">log</span><span class="pl-kos">(</span><span class="pl-s">"HTTP request failed: "</span> + <span class="pl-s1">response</span><span class="pl-kos">.</span><span class="pl-en">code</span><span class="pl-kos">.</span><span class="pl-en">to_s</span><span class="pl-kos">)</span>
  <span class="pl-k">end</span>
<span class="pl-k">end</span>

<span class="pl-s1">request</span><span class="pl-kos">.</span><span class="pl-en">run</span></pre></div>
<p dir="auto">This also works with serial (blocking) requests in the same fashion. Both
serial and parallel requests return a Response object.</p>
<h3 dir="auto"><a id="user-content-handling-file-uploads" class="anchor" aria-hidden="true" href="#handling-file-uploads"><svg class="octicon octicon-link" viewBox="0 0 16 16" version="1.1" width="16" height="16" aria-hidden="true"><path fill-rule="evenodd" d="M7.775 3.275a.75.75 0 001.06 1.06l1.25-1.25a2 2 0 112.83 2.83l-2.5 2.5a2 2 0 01-2.83 0 .75.75 0 00-1.06 1.06 3.5 3.5 0 004.95 0l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 00-4.95-4.95l-1.25 1.25zm-4.69 9.64a2 2 0 010-2.83l2.5-2.5a2 2 0 012.83 0 .75.75 0 001.06-1.06 3.5 3.5 0 00-4.95 0l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 004.95 4.95l1.25-1.25a.75.75 0 00-1.06-1.06l-1.25 1.25a2 2 0 01-2.83 0z"></path></svg></a>Handling file uploads</h3>
<p dir="auto">A File object can be passed as a param for a POST request to handle uploading
files to the server. Typhoeus will upload the file as the original file name
and use Mime::Types to set the content type.</p>
<div class="highlight highlight-source-ruby notranslate position-relative overflow-auto" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content="Typhoeus.post(
  "http://localhost:3000/posts",
  body: {
    title: "test post",
    content: "this is my test",
    file: File.open("thesis.txt","r")
  }
)"><pre><span class="pl-v">Typhoeus</span><span class="pl-kos">.</span><span class="pl-en">post</span><span class="pl-kos">(</span>
  <span class="pl-s">"http://localhost:3000/posts"</span><span class="pl-kos">,</span>
  <span class="pl-pds">body</span>: <span class="pl-kos">{</span>
    <span class="pl-pds">title</span>: <span class="pl-s">"test post"</span><span class="pl-kos">,</span>
    <span class="pl-pds">content</span>: <span class="pl-s">"this is my test"</span><span class="pl-kos">,</span>
    <span class="pl-pds">file</span>: <span class="pl-v">File</span><span class="pl-kos">.</span><span class="pl-en">open</span><span class="pl-kos">(</span><span class="pl-s">"thesis.txt"</span><span class="pl-kos">,</span><span class="pl-s">"r"</span><span class="pl-kos">)</span>
  <span class="pl-kos">}</span>
<span class="pl-kos">)</span></pre></div>
<h3 dir="auto"><a id="user-content-streaming-the-response-body" class="anchor" aria-hidden="true" href="#streaming-the-response-body"><svg class="octicon octicon-link" viewBox="0 0 16 16" version="1.1" width="16" height="16" aria-hidden="true"><path fill-rule="evenodd" d="M7.775 3.275a.75.75 0 001.06 1.06l1.25-1.25a2 2 0 112.83 2.83l-2.5 2.5a2 2 0 01-2.83 0 .75.75 0 00-1.06 1.06 3.5 3.5 0 004.95 0l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 00-4.95-4.95l-1.25 1.25zm-4.69 9.64a2 2 0 010-2.83l2.5-2.5a2 2 0 012.83 0 .75.75 0 001.06-1.06 3.5 3.5 0 00-4.95 0l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 004.95 4.95l1.25-1.25a.75.75 0 00-1.06-1.06l-1.25 1.25a2 2 0 01-2.83 0z"></path></svg></a>Streaming the response body</h3>
<p dir="auto">Typhoeus can stream responses. When you're expecting a large response,
set the <code>on_body</code> callback on a request. Typhoeus will yield to the callback
with chunks of the response, as they're read. When you set an <code>on_body</code> callback,
Typhoeus will not store the complete response.</p>
<div class="highlight highlight-source-ruby notranslate position-relative overflow-auto" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content="downloaded_file = File.open 'huge.iso', 'wb'
request = Typhoeus::Request.new("www.example.com/huge.iso")
request.on_headers do |response|
  if response.code != 200
    raise "Request failed"
  end
end
request.on_body do |chunk|
  downloaded_file.write(chunk)
end
request.on_complete do |response|
  downloaded_file.close
  # Note that response.body is ""
end
request.run"><pre><span class="pl-s1">downloaded_file</span> <span class="pl-c1">=</span> <span class="pl-v">File</span><span class="pl-kos">.</span><span class="pl-en">open</span> <span class="pl-s">'huge.iso'</span><span class="pl-kos">,</span> <span class="pl-s">'wb'</span>
<span class="pl-s1">request</span> <span class="pl-c1">=</span> <span class="pl-v">Typhoeus</span>::<span class="pl-v">Request</span><span class="pl-kos">.</span><span class="pl-en">new</span><span class="pl-kos">(</span><span class="pl-s">"www.example.com/huge.iso"</span><span class="pl-kos">)</span>
<span class="pl-s1">request</span><span class="pl-kos">.</span><span class="pl-en">on_headers</span> <span class="pl-k">do</span> |<span class="pl-s1">response</span>|
  <span class="pl-k">if</span> <span class="pl-s1">response</span><span class="pl-kos">.</span><span class="pl-en">code</span> != <span class="pl-c1">200</span>
    <span class="pl-en">raise</span> <span class="pl-s">"Request failed"</span>
  <span class="pl-k">end</span>
<span class="pl-k">end</span>
<span class="pl-s1">request</span><span class="pl-kos">.</span><span class="pl-en">on_body</span> <span class="pl-k">do</span> |<span class="pl-s1">chunk</span>|
  <span class="pl-s1">downloaded_file</span><span class="pl-kos">.</span><span class="pl-en">write</span><span class="pl-kos">(</span><span class="pl-s1">chunk</span><span class="pl-kos">)</span>
<span class="pl-k">end</span>
<span class="pl-s1">request</span><span class="pl-kos">.</span><span class="pl-en">on_complete</span> <span class="pl-k">do</span> |<span class="pl-s1">response</span>|
  <span class="pl-s1">downloaded_file</span><span class="pl-kos">.</span><span class="pl-en">close</span>
  <span class="pl-c"># Note that response.body is ""</span>
<span class="pl-k">end</span>
<span class="pl-s1">request</span><span class="pl-kos">.</span><span class="pl-en">run</span></pre></div>
<p dir="auto">If you need to interrupt the stream halfway,
you can return the <code>:abort</code> symbol from the <code>on_body</code> block, example:</p>
<div class="highlight highlight-source-ruby notranslate position-relative overflow-auto" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content="request.on_body do |chunk|
  buffer << chunk
  :abort if buffer.size > 1024 * 1024
end"><pre><span class="pl-en">request</span><span class="pl-kos">.</span><span class="pl-en">on_body</span> <span class="pl-k">do</span> |<span class="pl-s1">chunk</span>|
  <span class="pl-en">buffer</span> << <span class="pl-s1">chunk</span>
  <span class="pl-pds">:abort</span> <span class="pl-k">if</span> <span class="pl-en">buffer</span><span class="pl-kos">.</span><span class="pl-en">size</span> > <span class="pl-c1">1024</span> * <span class="pl-c1">1024</span>
<span class="pl-k">end</span></pre></div>
<p dir="auto">This will properly stop the stream internally and avoid any memory leak which
may happen if you interrupt with something like a <code>return</code>, <code>throw</code> or <code>raise</code>.</p>
<h3 dir="auto"><a id="user-content-making-parallel-requests" class="anchor" aria-hidden="true" href="#making-parallel-requests"><svg class="octicon octicon-link" viewBox="0 0 16 16" version="1.1" width="16" height="16" aria-hidden="true"><path fill-rule="evenodd" d="M7.775 3.275a.75.75 0 001.06 1.06l1.25-1.25a2 2 0 112.83 2.83l-2.5 2.5a2 2 0 01-2.83 0 .75.75 0 00-1.06 1.06 3.5 3.5 0 004.95 0l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 00-4.95-4.95l-1.25 1.25zm-4.69 9.64a2 2 0 010-2.83l2.5-2.5a2 2 0 012.83 0 .75.75 0 001.06-1.06 3.5 3.5 0 00-4.95 0l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 004.95 4.95l1.25-1.25a.75.75 0 00-1.06-1.06l-1.25 1.25a2 2 0 01-2.83 0z"></path></svg></a>Making Parallel Requests</h3>
<p dir="auto">Generally, you should be running requests through hydra. Here is how that looks:</p>
<div class="highlight highlight-source-ruby notranslate position-relative overflow-auto" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content="hydra = Typhoeus::Hydra.hydra

first_request = Typhoeus::Request.new("http://example.com/posts/1")
first_request.on_complete do |response|
  third_url = response.body
  third_request = Typhoeus::Request.new(third_url)
  hydra.queue third_request
end
second_request = Typhoeus::Request.new("http://example.com/posts/2")

hydra.queue first_request
hydra.queue second_request
hydra.run # this is a blocking call that returns once all requests are complete"><pre><span class="pl-s1">hydra</span> <span class="pl-c1">=</span> <span class="pl-v">Typhoeus</span>::<span class="pl-v">Hydra</span><span class="pl-kos">.</span><span class="pl-s1">hydra</span>

<span class="pl-s1">first_request</span> <span class="pl-c1">=</span> <span class="pl-v">Typhoeus</span>::<span class="pl-v">Request</span><span class="pl-kos">.</span><span class="pl-en">new</span><span class="pl-kos">(</span><span class="pl-s">"http://example.com/posts/1"</span><span class="pl-kos">)</span>
<span class="pl-s1">first_request</span><span class="pl-kos">.</span><span class="pl-en">on_complete</span> <span class="pl-k">do</span> |<span class="pl-s1">response</span>|
  <span class="pl-s1">third_url</span> <span class="pl-c1">=</span> <span class="pl-s1">response</span><span class="pl-kos">.</span><span class="pl-en">body</span>
  <span class="pl-s1">third_request</span> <span class="pl-c1">=</span> <span class="pl-v">Typhoeus</span>::<span class="pl-v">Request</span><span class="pl-kos">.</span><span class="pl-en">new</span><span class="pl-kos">(</span><span class="pl-s1">third_url</span><span class="pl-kos">)</span>
  <span class="pl-s1">hydra</span><span class="pl-kos">.</span><span class="pl-en">queue</span> <span class="pl-s1">third_request</span>
<span class="pl-k">end</span>
<span class="pl-s1">second_request</span> <span class="pl-c1">=</span> <span class="pl-v">Typhoeus</span>::<span class="pl-v">Request</span><span class="pl-kos">.</span><span class="pl-en">new</span><span class="pl-kos">(</span><span class="pl-s">"http://example.com/posts/2"</span><span class="pl-kos">)</span>

<span class="pl-s1">hydra</span><span class="pl-kos">.</span><span class="pl-en">queue</span> <span class="pl-s1">first_request</span>
<span class="pl-s1">hydra</span><span class="pl-kos">.</span><span class="pl-en">queue</span> <span class="pl-s1">second_request</span>
<span class="pl-s1">hydra</span><span class="pl-kos">.</span><span class="pl-en">run</span> <span class="pl-c"># this is a blocking call that returns once all requests are complete</span></pre></div>
<p dir="auto">The execution of that code goes something like this. The first and second requests are built and queued. When hydra is run the first and second requests run in parallel. When the first request completes, the third request is then built and queued, in this example based on the result of the first request. The moment it is queued Hydra starts executing it.  Meanwhile the second request would continue to run (or it could have completed before the first). Once the third request is done, <code>hydra.run</code> returns.</p>
<p dir="auto">How to get an array of response bodies back after executing a queue:</p>
<div class="highlight highlight-source-ruby notranslate position-relative overflow-auto" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content="hydra = Typhoeus::Hydra.new
requests = 10.times.map {
  request = Typhoeus::Request.new("www.example.com", followlocation: true)
  hydra.queue(request)
  request
}
hydra.run

responses = requests.map { |request|
  request.response.body
}"><pre><span class="pl-s1">hydra</span> <span class="pl-c1">=</span> <span class="pl-v">Typhoeus</span>::<span class="pl-v">Hydra</span><span class="pl-kos">.</span><span class="pl-en">new</span>
<span class="pl-s1">requests</span> <span class="pl-c1">=</span> <span class="pl-c1">10</span><span class="pl-kos">.</span><span class="pl-en">times</span><span class="pl-kos">.</span><span class="pl-en">map</span> <span class="pl-kos">{</span>
  <span class="pl-s1">request</span> <span class="pl-c1">=</span> <span class="pl-v">Typhoeus</span>::<span class="pl-v">Request</span><span class="pl-kos">.</span><span class="pl-en">new</span><span class="pl-kos">(</span><span class="pl-s">"www.example.com"</span><span class="pl-kos">,</span> <span class="pl-pds">followlocation</span>: <span class="pl-c1">true</span><span class="pl-kos">)</span>
  <span class="pl-s1">hydra</span><span class="pl-kos">.</span><span class="pl-en">queue</span><span class="pl-kos">(</span><span class="pl-s1">request</span><span class="pl-kos">)</span>
  <span class="pl-s1">request</span>
<span class="pl-kos">}</span>
<span class="pl-s1">hydra</span><span class="pl-kos">.</span><span class="pl-en">run</span>

<span class="pl-s1">responses</span> <span class="pl-c1">=</span> <span class="pl-s1">requests</span><span class="pl-kos">.</span><span class="pl-en">map</span> <span class="pl-kos">{</span> |<span class="pl-s1">request</span>|
  <span class="pl-s1">request</span><span class="pl-kos">.</span><span class="pl-en">response</span><span class="pl-kos">.</span><span class="pl-en">body</span>
<span class="pl-kos">}</span></pre></div>
<p dir="auto"><code>hydra.run</code> is a blocking request. You can also use the <code>on_complete</code> callback to handle each request as it completes:</p>
<div class="highlight highlight-source-ruby notranslate position-relative overflow-auto" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content="hydra = Typhoeus::Hydra.new
10.times do
  request = Typhoeus::Request.new("www.example.com", followlocation: true)
  request.on_complete do |response|
    #do_something_with response
  end
  hydra.queue(request)
end
hydra.run"><pre><span class="pl-s1">hydra</span> <span class="pl-c1">=</span> <span class="pl-v">Typhoeus</span>::<span class="pl-v">Hydra</span><span class="pl-kos">.</span><span class="pl-en">new</span>
<span class="pl-c1">10</span><span class="pl-kos">.</span><span class="pl-en">times</span> <span class="pl-k">do</span>
  <span class="pl-s1">request</span> <span class="pl-c1">=</span> <span class="pl-v">Typhoeus</span>::<span class="pl-v">Request</span><span class="pl-kos">.</span><span class="pl-en">new</span><span class="pl-kos">(</span><span class="pl-s">"www.example.com"</span><span class="pl-kos">,</span> <span class="pl-pds">followlocation</span>: <span class="pl-c1">true</span><span class="pl-kos">)</span>
  <span class="pl-s1">request</span><span class="pl-kos">.</span><span class="pl-en">on_complete</span> <span class="pl-k">do</span> |<span class="pl-s1">response</span>|
    <span class="pl-c">#do_something_with response</span>
  <span class="pl-k">end</span>
  <span class="pl-s1">hydra</span><span class="pl-kos">.</span><span class="pl-en">queue</span><span class="pl-kos">(</span><span class="pl-s1">request</span><span class="pl-kos">)</span>
<span class="pl-k">end</span>
<span class="pl-s1">hydra</span><span class="pl-kos">.</span><span class="pl-en">run</span></pre></div>
<h3 dir="auto"><a id="user-content-making-parallel-requests-with-faraday--typhoeus" class="anchor" aria-hidden="true" href="#making-parallel-requests-with-faraday--typhoeus"><svg class="octicon octicon-link" viewBox="0 0 16 16" version="1.1" width="16" height="16" aria-hidden="true"><path fill-rule="evenodd" d="M7.775 3.275a.75.75 0 001.06 1.06l1.25-1.25a2 2 0 112.83 2.83l-2.5 2.5a2 2 0 01-2.83 0 .75.75 0 00-1.06 1.06 3.5 3.5 0 004.95 0l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 00-4.95-4.95l-1.25 1.25zm-4.69 9.64a2 2 0 010-2.83l2.5-2.5a2 2 0 012.83 0 .75.75 0 001.06-1.06 3.5 3.5 0 00-4.95 0l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 004.95 4.95l1.25-1.25a.75.75 0 00-1.06-1.06l-1.25 1.25a2 2 0 01-2.83 0z"></path></svg></a>Making Parallel Requests with Faraday + Typhoeus</h3>
<div class="highlight highlight-source-ruby notranslate position-relative overflow-auto" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content="require 'faraday'

conn = Faraday.new(:url => 'http://httppage.com') do |builder|
  builder.request  :url_encoded
  builder.response :logger
  builder.adapter  :typhoeus
end

conn.in_parallel do
  response1 = conn.get('/first')
  response2 = conn.get('/second')

  # these will return nil here since the
  # requests have not been completed
  response1.body
  response2.body
end

# after it has been completed the response information is fully available
# response1.status, etc
response1.body
response2.body"><pre><span class="pl-en">require</span> <span class="pl-s">'faraday'</span>

<span class="pl-s1">conn</span> <span class="pl-c1">=</span> <span class="pl-v">Faraday</span><span class="pl-kos">.</span><span class="pl-en">new</span><span class="pl-kos">(</span><span class="pl-pds">:url</span> <span class="pl-c1">=></span> <span class="pl-s">'http://httppage.com'</span><span class="pl-kos">)</span> <span class="pl-k">do</span> |<span class="pl-s1">builder</span>|
  <span class="pl-s1">builder</span><span class="pl-kos">.</span><span class="pl-en">request</span>  <span class="pl-pds">:url_encoded</span>
  <span class="pl-s1">builder</span><span class="pl-kos">.</span><span class="pl-en">response</span> <span class="pl-pds">:logger</span>
  <span class="pl-s1">builder</span><span class="pl-kos">.</span><span class="pl-en">adapter</span>  <span class="pl-pds">:typhoeus</span>
<span class="pl-k">end</span>

<span class="pl-s1">conn</span><span class="pl-kos">.</span><span class="pl-en">in_parallel</span> <span class="pl-k">do</span>
  <span class="pl-s1">response1</span> <span class="pl-c1">=</span> <span class="pl-s1">conn</span><span class="pl-kos">.</span><span class="pl-en">get</span><span class="pl-kos">(</span><span class="pl-s">'/first'</span><span class="pl-kos">)</span>
  <span class="pl-s1">response2</span> <span class="pl-c1">=</span> <span class="pl-s1">conn</span><span class="pl-kos">.</span><span class="pl-en">get</span><span class="pl-kos">(</span><span class="pl-s">'/second'</span><span class="pl-kos">)</span>

  <span class="pl-c"># these will return nil here since the</span>
  <span class="pl-c"># requests have not been completed</span>
  <span class="pl-s1">response1</span><span class="pl-kos">.</span><span class="pl-en">body</span>
  <span class="pl-s1">response2</span><span class="pl-kos">.</span><span class="pl-en">body</span>
<span class="pl-k">end</span>

<span class="pl-c"># after it has been completed the response information is fully available</span>
<span class="pl-c"># response1.status, etc</span>
<span class="pl-en">response1</span><span class="pl-kos">.</span><span class="pl-en">body</span>
<span class="pl-en">response2</span><span class="pl-kos">.</span><span class="pl-en">body</span></pre></div>
<h3 dir="auto"><a id="user-content-specifying-max-concurrency" class="anchor" aria-hidden="true" href="#specifying-max-concurrency"><svg class="octicon octicon-link" viewBox="0 0 16 16" version="1.1" width="16" height="16" aria-hidden="true"><path fill-rule="evenodd" d="M7.775 3.275a.75.75 0 001.06 1.06l1.25-1.25a2 2 0 112.83 2.83l-2.5 2.5a2 2 0 01-2.83 0 .75.75 0 00-1.06 1.06 3.5 3.5 0 004.95 0l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 00-4.95-4.95l-1.25 1.25zm-4.69 9.64a2 2 0 010-2.83l2.5-2.5a2 2 0 012.83 0 .75.75 0 001.06-1.06 3.5 3.5 0 00-4.95 0l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 004.95 4.95l1.25-1.25a.75.75 0 00-1.06-1.06l-1.25 1.25a2 2 0 01-2.83 0z"></path></svg></a>Specifying Max Concurrency</h3>
<p dir="auto">Hydra will also handle how many requests you can make in parallel. Things will get flakey if you try to make too many requests at the same time. The built in limit is 200. When more requests than that are queued up, hydra will save them for later and start the requests as others are finished. You can raise or lower the concurrency limit through the Hydra constructor.</p>
<div class="highlight highlight-source-ruby notranslate position-relative overflow-auto" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content="Typhoeus::Hydra.new(max_concurrency: 20)"><pre><span class="pl-v">Typhoeus</span>::<span class="pl-v">Hydra</span><span class="pl-kos">.</span><span class="pl-en">new</span><span class="pl-kos">(</span><span class="pl-pds">max_concurrency</span>: <span class="pl-c1">20</span><span class="pl-kos">)</span></pre></div>
<h3 dir="auto"><a id="user-content-memoization" class="anchor" aria-hidden="true" href="#memoization"><svg class="octicon octicon-link" viewBox="0 0 16 16" version="1.1" width="16" height="16" aria-hidden="true"><path fill-rule="evenodd" d="M7.775 3.275a.75.75 0 001.06 1.06l1.25-1.25a2 2 0 112.83 2.83l-2.5 2.5a2 2 0 01-2.83 0 .75.75 0 00-1.06 1.06 3.5 3.5 0 004.95 0l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 00-4.95-4.95l-1.25 1.25zm-4.69 9.64a2 2 0 010-2.83l2.5-2.5a2 2 0 012.83 0 .75.75 0 001.06-1.06 3.5 3.5 0 00-4.95 0l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 004.95 4.95l1.25-1.25a.75.75 0 00-1.06-1.06l-1.25 1.25a2 2 0 01-2.83 0z"></path></svg></a>Memoization</h3>
<p dir="auto">Hydra memoizes requests within a single run call. You have to enable memoization.
This will result in a single request being issued. However, the on_complete handlers of both will be called.</p>
<div class="highlight highlight-source-ruby notranslate position-relative overflow-auto" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content="Typhoeus::Config.memoize = true

hydra = Typhoeus::Hydra.new(max_concurrency: 1)
2.times do
  hydra.queue Typhoeus::Request.new("www.example.com")
end
hydra.run"><pre><span class="pl-v">Typhoeus</span>::<span class="pl-v">Config</span><span class="pl-kos">.</span><span class="pl-en">memoize</span> <span class="pl-c1">=</span> <span class="pl-c1">true</span>

<span class="pl-s1">hydra</span> <span class="pl-c1">=</span> <span class="pl-v">Typhoeus</span>::<span class="pl-v">Hydra</span><span class="pl-kos">.</span><span class="pl-en">new</span><span class="pl-kos">(</span><span class="pl-pds">max_concurrency</span>: <span class="pl-c1">1</span><span class="pl-kos">)</span>
<span class="pl-c1">2</span><span class="pl-kos">.</span><span class="pl-en">times</span> <span class="pl-k">do</span>
  <span class="pl-s1">hydra</span><span class="pl-kos">.</span><span class="pl-en">queue</span> <span class="pl-v">Typhoeus</span>::<span class="pl-v">Request</span><span class="pl-kos">.</span><span class="pl-en">new</span><span class="pl-kos">(</span><span class="pl-s">"www.example.com"</span><span class="pl-kos">)</span>
<span class="pl-k">end</span>
<span class="pl-s1">hydra</span><span class="pl-kos">.</span><span class="pl-en">run</span></pre></div>
<p dir="auto">This will result in two requests.</p>
<div class="highlight highlight-source-ruby notranslate position-relative overflow-auto" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content="Typhoeus::Config.memoize = false

hydra = Typhoeus::Hydra.new(max_concurrency: 1)
2.times do
  hydra.queue Typhoeus::Request.new("www.example.com")
end
hydra.run"><pre><span class="pl-v">Typhoeus</span>::<span class="pl-v">Config</span><span class="pl-kos">.</span><span class="pl-en">memoize</span> <span class="pl-c1">=</span> <span class="pl-c1">false</span>

<span class="pl-s1">hydra</span> <span class="pl-c1">=</span> <span class="pl-v">Typhoeus</span>::<span class="pl-v">Hydra</span><span class="pl-kos">.</span><span class="pl-en">new</span><span class="pl-kos">(</span><span class="pl-pds">max_concurrency</span>: <span class="pl-c1">1</span><span class="pl-kos">)</span>
<span class="pl-c1">2</span><span class="pl-kos">.</span><span class="pl-en">times</span> <span class="pl-k">do</span>
  <span class="pl-s1">hydra</span><span class="pl-kos">.</span><span class="pl-en">queue</span> <span class="pl-v">Typhoeus</span>::<span class="pl-v">Request</span><span class="pl-kos">.</span><span class="pl-en">new</span><span class="pl-kos">(</span><span class="pl-s">"www.example.com"</span><span class="pl-kos">)</span>
<span class="pl-k">end</span>
<span class="pl-s1">hydra</span><span class="pl-kos">.</span><span class="pl-en">run</span></pre></div>
<h3 dir="auto"><a id="user-content-caching" class="anchor" aria-hidden="true" href="#caching"><svg class="octicon octicon-link" viewBox="0 0 16 16" version="1.1" width="16" height="16" aria-hidden="true"><path fill-rule="evenodd" d="M7.775 3.275a.75.75 0 001.06 1.06l1.25-1.25a2 2 0 112.83 2.83l-2.5 2.5a2 2 0 01-2.83 0 .75.75 0 00-1.06 1.06 3.5 3.5 0 004.95 0l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 00-4.95-4.95l-1.25 1.25zm-4.69 9.64a2 2 0 010-2.83l2.5-2.5a2 2 0 012.83 0 .75.75 0 001.06-1.06 3.5 3.5 0 00-4.95 0l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 004.95 4.95l1.25-1.25a.75.75 0 00-1.06-1.06l-1.25 1.25a2 2 0 01-2.83 0z"></path></svg></a>Caching</h3>
<p dir="auto">Typhoeus includes built in support for caching. In the following example, if there is a cache hit, the cached object is passed to the on_complete handler of the request object.</p>
<div class="highlight highlight-source-ruby notranslate position-relative overflow-auto" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content="class Cache
  def initialize
    @memory = {}
  end

  def get(request)
    @memory[request]
  end

  def set(request, response)
    @memory[request] = response
  end
end

Typhoeus::Config.cache = Cache.new

Typhoeus.get("www.example.com").cached?
#=> false
Typhoeus.get("www.example.com").cached?
#=> true"><pre><span class="pl-k">class</span> <span class="pl-v">Cache</span>
  <span class="pl-k">def</span> <span class="pl-en">initialize</span>
    <span class="pl-c1">@memory</span> <span class="pl-c1">=</span> <span class="pl-kos">{</span><span class="pl-kos">}</span>
  <span class="pl-k">end</span>

  <span class="pl-k">def</span> <span class="pl-en">get</span><span class="pl-kos">(</span><span class="pl-s1">request</span><span class="pl-kos">)</span>
    <span class="pl-c1">@memory</span><span class="pl-kos">[</span><span class="pl-s1">request</span><span class="pl-kos">]</span>
  <span class="pl-k">end</span>

  <span class="pl-k">def</span> <span class="pl-en">set</span><span class="pl-kos">(</span><span class="pl-s1">request</span><span class="pl-kos">,</span> <span class="pl-s1">response</span><span class="pl-kos">)</span>
    <span class="pl-c1">@memory</span><span class="pl-kos">[</span><span class="pl-s1">request</span><span class="pl-kos">]</span> <span class="pl-c1">=</span> <span class="pl-s1">response</span>
  <span class="pl-k">end</span>
<span class="pl-k">end</span>

<span class="pl-v">Typhoeus</span>::<span class="pl-v">Config</span><span class="pl-kos">.</span><span class="pl-en">cache</span> <span class="pl-c1">=</span> <span class="pl-v">Cache</span><span class="pl-kos">.</span><span class="pl-en">new</span>

<span class="pl-v">Typhoeus</span><span class="pl-kos">.</span><span class="pl-en">get</span><span class="pl-kos">(</span><span class="pl-s">"www.example.com"</span><span class="pl-kos">)</span><span class="pl-kos">.</span><span class="pl-en">cached?</span>
<span class="pl-c">#=> false</span>
<span class="pl-v">Typhoeus</span><span class="pl-kos">.</span><span class="pl-en">get</span><span class="pl-kos">(</span><span class="pl-s">"www.example.com"</span><span class="pl-kos">)</span><span class="pl-kos">.</span><span class="pl-en">cached?</span>
<span class="pl-c">#=> true</span></pre></div>
<p dir="auto">For use with <a href="https://github.com/mperham/dalli">Dalli</a>:</p>
<div class="highlight highlight-source-ruby notranslate position-relative overflow-auto" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content="require "typhoeus/cache/dalli"

dalli = Dalli::Client.new(...)
Typhoeus::Config.cache = Typhoeus::Cache::Dalli.new(dalli)"><pre><span class="pl-en">require</span> <span class="pl-s">"typhoeus/cache/dalli"</span>

<span class="pl-s1">dalli</span> <span class="pl-c1">=</span> <span class="pl-v">Dalli</span>::<span class="pl-v">Client</span><span class="pl-kos">.</span><span class="pl-en">new</span><span class="pl-kos">(</span>...<span class="pl-kos">)</span>
<span class="pl-v">Typhoeus</span>::<span class="pl-v">Config</span><span class="pl-kos">.</span><span class="pl-en">cache</span> <span class="pl-c1">=</span> <span class="pl-v">Typhoeus</span>::<span class="pl-v">Cache</span>::<span class="pl-v">Dalli</span><span class="pl-kos">.</span><span class="pl-en">new</span><span class="pl-kos">(</span><span class="pl-s1">dalli</span><span class="pl-kos">)</span></pre></div>
<p dir="auto">For use with Rails:</p>
<div class="highlight highlight-source-ruby notranslate position-relative overflow-auto" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content="require "typhoeus/cache/rails"

Typhoeus::Config.cache = Typhoeus::Cache::Rails.new"><pre><span class="pl-en">require</span> <span class="pl-s">"typhoeus/cache/rails"</span>

<span class="pl-v">Typhoeus</span>::<span class="pl-v">Config</span><span class="pl-kos">.</span><span class="pl-en">cache</span> <span class="pl-c1">=</span> <span class="pl-v">Typhoeus</span>::<span class="pl-v">Cache</span>::<span class="pl-v">Rails</span><span class="pl-kos">.</span><span class="pl-en">new</span></pre></div>
<p dir="auto">For use with <a href="https://github.com/redis/redis-rb">Redis</a>:</p>
<div class="highlight highlight-source-ruby notranslate position-relative overflow-auto" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content="require "typhoeus/cache/redis"

redis = Redis.new(...)
Typhoeus::Config.cache = Typhoeus::Cache::Redis.new(redis)"><pre><span class="pl-en">require</span> <span class="pl-s">"typhoeus/cache/redis"</span>

<span class="pl-s1">redis</span> <span class="pl-c1">=</span> <span class="pl-v">Redis</span><span class="pl-kos">.</span><span class="pl-en">new</span><span class="pl-kos">(</span>...<span class="pl-kos">)</span>
<span class="pl-v">Typhoeus</span>::<span class="pl-v">Config</span><span class="pl-kos">.</span><span class="pl-en">cache</span> <span class="pl-c1">=</span> <span class="pl-v">Typhoeus</span>::<span class="pl-v">Cache</span>::<span class="pl-v">Redis</span><span class="pl-kos">.</span><span class="pl-en">new</span><span class="pl-kos">(</span><span class="pl-s1">redis</span><span class="pl-kos">)</span></pre></div>
<p dir="auto">All three of these adapters take an optional keyword argument <code>default_ttl</code>, which sets a default
TTL on cached responses (in seconds), for requests which do not have a cache TTL set.</p>
<p dir="auto">You may also selectively choose not to cache by setting <code>cache</code> to <code>false</code> on a request or to use
a different adapter.</p>
<div class="highlight highlight-source-ruby notranslate position-relative overflow-auto" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content="cache = Cache.new
Typhoeus.get("www.example.com", cache: cache)"><pre><span class="pl-s1">cache</span> <span class="pl-c1">=</span> <span class="pl-v">Cache</span><span class="pl-kos">.</span><span class="pl-en">new</span>
<span class="pl-v">Typhoeus</span><span class="pl-kos">.</span><span class="pl-en">get</span><span class="pl-kos">(</span><span class="pl-s">"www.example.com"</span><span class="pl-kos">,</span> <span class="pl-pds">cache</span>: <span class="pl-s1">cache</span><span class="pl-kos">)</span></pre></div>
<h3 dir="auto"><a id="user-content-direct-stubbing" class="anchor" aria-hidden="true" href="#direct-stubbing"><svg class="octicon octicon-link" viewBox="0 0 16 16" version="1.1" width="16" height="16" aria-hidden="true"><path fill-rule="evenodd" d="M7.775 3.275a.75.75 0 001.06 1.06l1.25-1.25a2 2 0 112.83 2.83l-2.5 2.5a2 2 0 01-2.83 0 .75.75 0 00-1.06 1.06 3.5 3.5 0 004.95 0l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 00-4.95-4.95l-1.25 1.25zm-4.69 9.64a2 2 0 010-2.83l2.5-2.5a2 2 0 012.83 0 .75.75 0 001.06-1.06 3.5 3.5 0 00-4.95 0l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 004.95 4.95l1.25-1.25a.75.75 0 00-1.06-1.06l-1.25 1.25a2 2 0 01-2.83 0z"></path></svg></a>Direct Stubbing</h3>
<p dir="auto">Hydra allows you to stub out specific urls and patterns to avoid hitting
remote servers while testing.</p>
<div class="highlight highlight-source-ruby notranslate position-relative overflow-auto" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content="response = Typhoeus::Response.new(code: 200, body: "{'name' : 'paul'}")
Typhoeus.stub('www.example.com').and_return(response)

Typhoeus.get("www.example.com") == response
#=> true"><pre><span class="pl-s1">response</span> <span class="pl-c1">=</span> <span class="pl-v">Typhoeus</span>::<span class="pl-v">Response</span><span class="pl-kos">.</span><span class="pl-en">new</span><span class="pl-kos">(</span><span class="pl-pds">code</span>: <span class="pl-c1">200</span><span class="pl-kos">,</span> <span class="pl-pds">body</span>: <span class="pl-s">"{'name' : 'paul'}"</span><span class="pl-kos">)</span>
<span class="pl-v">Typhoeus</span><span class="pl-kos">.</span><span class="pl-en">stub</span><span class="pl-kos">(</span><span class="pl-s">'www.example.com'</span><span class="pl-kos">)</span><span class="pl-kos">.</span><span class="pl-en">and_return</span><span class="pl-kos">(</span><span class="pl-s1">response</span><span class="pl-kos">)</span>

<span class="pl-v">Typhoeus</span><span class="pl-kos">.</span><span class="pl-en">get</span><span class="pl-kos">(</span><span class="pl-s">"www.example.com"</span><span class="pl-kos">)</span> == <span class="pl-s1">response</span>
<span class="pl-c">#=> true</span></pre></div>
<p dir="auto">The queued request will hit the stub. You can also specify a regex to match urls.</p>
<div class="highlight highlight-source-ruby notranslate position-relative overflow-auto" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content="response = Typhoeus::Response.new(code: 200, body: "{'name' : 'paul'}")
Typhoeus.stub(/example/).and_return(response)

Typhoeus.get("www.example.com") == response
#=> true"><pre><span class="pl-s1">response</span> <span class="pl-c1">=</span> <span class="pl-v">Typhoeus</span>::<span class="pl-v">Response</span><span class="pl-kos">.</span><span class="pl-en">new</span><span class="pl-kos">(</span><span class="pl-pds">code</span>: <span class="pl-c1">200</span><span class="pl-kos">,</span> <span class="pl-pds">body</span>: <span class="pl-s">"{'name' : 'paul'}"</span><span class="pl-kos">)</span>
<span class="pl-v">Typhoeus</span><span class="pl-kos">.</span><span class="pl-en">stub</span><span class="pl-kos">(</span><span class="pl-pds">/example/</span><span class="pl-kos">)</span><span class="pl-kos">.</span><span class="pl-en">and_return</span><span class="pl-kos">(</span><span class="pl-s1">response</span><span class="pl-kos">)</span>

<span class="pl-v">Typhoeus</span><span class="pl-kos">.</span><span class="pl-en">get</span><span class="pl-kos">(</span><span class="pl-s">"www.example.com"</span><span class="pl-kos">)</span> == <span class="pl-s1">response</span>
<span class="pl-c">#=> true</span></pre></div>
<p dir="auto">You may also specify an array for the stub to return sequentially.</p>
<div class="highlight highlight-source-ruby notranslate position-relative overflow-auto" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content="Typhoeus.stub('www.example.com').and_return([response1, response2])

Typhoeus.get('www.example.com') == response1 #=> true
Typhoeus.get('www.example.com') == response2 #=> true"><pre><span class="pl-v">Typhoeus</span><span class="pl-kos">.</span><span class="pl-en">stub</span><span class="pl-kos">(</span><span class="pl-s">'www.example.com'</span><span class="pl-kos">)</span><span class="pl-kos">.</span><span class="pl-en">and_return</span><span class="pl-kos">(</span><span class="pl-kos">[</span><span class="pl-en">response1</span><span class="pl-kos">,</span> <span class="pl-en">response2</span><span class="pl-kos">]</span><span class="pl-kos">)</span>

<span class="pl-v">Typhoeus</span><span class="pl-kos">.</span><span class="pl-en">get</span><span class="pl-kos">(</span><span class="pl-s">'www.example.com'</span><span class="pl-kos">)</span> == <span class="pl-en">response1</span> <span class="pl-c">#=> true</span>
<span class="pl-v">Typhoeus</span><span class="pl-kos">.</span><span class="pl-en">get</span><span class="pl-kos">(</span><span class="pl-s">'www.example.com'</span><span class="pl-kos">)</span> == <span class="pl-en">response2</span> <span class="pl-c">#=> true</span></pre></div>
<p dir="auto">When testing make sure to clear your expectations or the stubs will persist between tests. The following can be included in your spec_helper.rb file to do this automatically.</p>
<div class="highlight highlight-source-ruby notranslate position-relative overflow-auto" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content="RSpec.configure do |config|
  config.before :each do
    Typhoeus::Expectation.clear
  end
end"><pre><span class="pl-v">RSpec</span><span class="pl-kos">.</span><span class="pl-en">configure</span> <span class="pl-k">do</span> |<span class="pl-s1">config</span>|
  <span class="pl-s1">config</span><span class="pl-kos">.</span><span class="pl-en">before</span> <span class="pl-pds">:each</span> <span class="pl-k">do</span>
    <span class="pl-v">Typhoeus</span>::<span class="pl-v">Expectation</span><span class="pl-kos">.</span><span class="pl-en">clear</span>
  <span class="pl-k">end</span>
<span class="pl-k">end</span></pre></div>
<h3 dir="auto"><a id="user-content-timeouts" class="anchor" aria-hidden="true" href="#timeouts"><svg class="octicon octicon-link" viewBox="0 0 16 16" version="1.1" width="16" height="16" aria-hidden="true"><path fill-rule="evenodd" d="M7.775 3.275a.75.75 0 001.06 1.06l1.25-1.25a2 2 0 112.83 2.83l-2.5 2.5a2 2 0 01-2.83 0 .75.75 0 00-1.06 1.06 3.5 3.5 0 004.95 0l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 00-4.95-4.95l-1.25 1.25zm-4.69 9.64a2 2 0 010-2.83l2.5-2.5a2 2 0 012.83 0 .75.75 0 001.06-1.06 3.5 3.5 0 00-4.95 0l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 004.95 4.95l1.25-1.25a.75.75 0 00-1.06-1.06l-1.25 1.25a2 2 0 01-2.83 0z"></path></svg></a>Timeouts</h3>
<p dir="auto">No exceptions are raised on HTTP timeouts. You can check whether a request timed out with the following method:</p>
<div class="highlight highlight-source-ruby notranslate position-relative overflow-auto" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content="Typhoeus.get("www.example.com", timeout: 1).timed_out?"><pre><span class="pl-v">Typhoeus</span><span class="pl-kos">.</span><span class="pl-en">get</span><span class="pl-kos">(</span><span class="pl-s">"www.example.com"</span><span class="pl-kos">,</span> <span class="pl-pds">timeout</span>: <span class="pl-c1">1</span><span class="pl-kos">)</span><span class="pl-kos">.</span><span class="pl-en">timed_out?</span></pre></div>
<p dir="auto">Timed out responses also have their success? method return false.</p>
<p dir="auto">There are two different timeouts available: <a href="http://curl.haxx.se/libcurl/c/curl_easy_setopt.html#CURLOPTTIMEOUT" rel="nofollow"><code>timeout</code></a>
and <a href="http://curl.haxx.se/libcurl/c/curl_easy_setopt.html#CURLOPTCONNECTTIMEOUT" rel="nofollow"><code>connecttimeout</code></a>.
<code>timeout</code> is the time limit for the entire request in seconds.
<code>connecttimeout</code> is the time limit for just the connection phase, again in seconds.</p>
<p dir="auto">There are two additional more fine grained options <code>timeout_ms</code> and
<code>connecttimeout_ms</code>. These options offer millisecond precision but are not always available (for instance on linux if <code>nosignal</code> is not set to true).</p>
<p dir="auto">When you pass a floating point <code>timeout</code> (or <code>connecttimeout</code>) Typhoeus will set <code>timeout_ms</code> for you if it has not been defined. The actual timeout values passed to curl will always be rounded up.</p>
<p dir="auto">DNS timeouts of less than one second are not supported unless curl is compiled with an asynchronous resolver.</p>
<p dir="auto">The default <code>timeout</code> is 0 (zero) which means curl never times out during transfer. The default <code>connecttimeout</code> is 300 seconds. A <code>connecttimeout</code> of 0 will also result in the default <code>connecttimeout</code> of 300 seconds.</p>
<h3 dir="auto"><a id="user-content-following-redirections" class="anchor" aria-hidden="true" href="#following-redirections"><svg class="octicon octicon-link" viewBox="0 0 16 16" version="1.1" width="16" height="16" aria-hidden="true"><path fill-rule="evenodd" d="M7.775 3.275a.75.75 0 001.06 1.06l1.25-1.25a2 2 0 112.83 2.83l-2.5 2.5a2 2 0 01-2.83 0 .75.75 0 00-1.06 1.06 3.5 3.5 0 004.95 0l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 00-4.95-4.95l-1.25 1.25zm-4.69 9.64a2 2 0 010-2.83l2.5-2.5a2 2 0 012.83 0 .75.75 0 001.06-1.06 3.5 3.5 0 00-4.95 0l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 004.95 4.95l1.25-1.25a.75.75 0 00-1.06-1.06l-1.25 1.25a2 2 0 01-2.83 0z"></path></svg></a>Following Redirections</h3>
<p dir="auto">Use <code>followlocation: true</code>, eg:</p>
<div class="highlight highlight-source-ruby notranslate position-relative overflow-auto" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content="Typhoeus.get("www.example.com", followlocation: true)"><pre><span class="pl-v">Typhoeus</span><span class="pl-kos">.</span><span class="pl-en">get</span><span class="pl-kos">(</span><span class="pl-s">"www.example.com"</span><span class="pl-kos">,</span> <span class="pl-pds">followlocation</span>: <span class="pl-c1">true</span><span class="pl-kos">)</span></pre></div>
<h3 dir="auto"><a id="user-content-basic-authentication" class="anchor" aria-hidden="true" href="#basic-authentication"><svg class="octicon octicon-link" viewBox="0 0 16 16" version="1.1" width="16" height="16" aria-hidden="true"><path fill-rule="evenodd" d="M7.775 3.275a.75.75 0 001.06 1.06l1.25-1.25a2 2 0 112.83 2.83l-2.5 2.5a2 2 0 01-2.83 0 .75.75 0 00-1.06 1.06 3.5 3.5 0 004.95 0l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 00-4.95-4.95l-1.25 1.25zm-4.69 9.64a2 2 0 010-2.83l2.5-2.5a2 2 0 012.83 0 .75.75 0 001.06-1.06 3.5 3.5 0 00-4.95 0l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 004.95 4.95l1.25-1.25a.75.75 0 00-1.06-1.06l-1.25 1.25a2 2 0 01-2.83 0z"></path></svg></a>Basic Authentication</h3>
<div class="highlight highlight-source-ruby notranslate position-relative overflow-auto" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content="Typhoeus::Request.get("www.example.com", userpwd: "user:password")"><pre><span class="pl-v">Typhoeus</span>::<span class="pl-v">Request</span><span class="pl-kos">.</span><span class="pl-en">get</span><span class="pl-kos">(</span><span class="pl-s">"www.example.com"</span><span class="pl-kos">,</span> <span class="pl-pds">userpwd</span>: <span class="pl-s">"user:password"</span><span class="pl-kos">)</span></pre></div>
<h3 dir="auto"><a id="user-content-compression" class="anchor" aria-hidden="true" href="#compression"><svg class="octicon octicon-link" viewBox="0 0 16 16" version="1.1" width="16" height="16" aria-hidden="true"><path fill-rule="evenodd" d="M7.775 3.275a.75.75 0 001.06 1.06l1.25-1.25a2 2 0 112.83 2.83l-2.5 2.5a2 2 0 01-2.83 0 .75.75 0 00-1.06 1.06 3.5 3.5 0 004.95 0l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 00-4.95-4.95l-1.25 1.25zm-4.69 9.64a2 2 0 010-2.83l2.5-2.5a2 2 0 012.83 0 .75.75 0 001.06-1.06 3.5 3.5 0 00-4.95 0l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 004.95 4.95l1.25-1.25a.75.75 0 00-1.06-1.06l-1.25 1.25a2 2 0 01-2.83 0z"></path></svg></a>Compression</h3>
<div class="highlight highlight-source-ruby notranslate position-relative overflow-auto" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content="Typhoeus.get("www.example.com", accept_encoding: "gzip")"><pre><span class="pl-v">Typhoeus</span><span class="pl-kos">.</span><span class="pl-en">get</span><span class="pl-kos">(</span><span class="pl-s">"www.example.com"</span><span class="pl-kos">,</span> <span class="pl-pds">accept_encoding</span>: <span class="pl-s">"gzip"</span><span class="pl-kos">)</span></pre></div>
<p dir="auto">The above has a different behavior than setting the header directly in the header hash, eg:</p>
<div class="highlight highlight-source-ruby notranslate position-relative overflow-auto" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content="Typhoeus.get("www.example.com", headers: {"Accept-Encoding" => "gzip"})"><pre><span class="pl-v">Typhoeus</span><span class="pl-kos">.</span><span class="pl-en">get</span><span class="pl-kos">(</span><span class="pl-s">"www.example.com"</span><span class="pl-kos">,</span> <span class="pl-pds">headers</span>: <span class="pl-kos">{</span><span class="pl-s">"Accept-Encoding"</span> <span class="pl-c1">=></span> <span class="pl-s">"gzip"</span><span class="pl-kos">}</span><span class="pl-kos">)</span></pre></div>
<p dir="auto">Setting the header hash directly will not include the <code>--compressed</code> flag in the libcurl command and therefore libcurl will not decompress the response.  If you want the <code>--compressed</code> flag to be added automatically, set <code>:accept_encoding</code> Typhoeus option.</p>
<h3 dir="auto"><a id="user-content-cookies" class="anchor" aria-hidden="true" href="#cookies"><svg class="octicon octicon-link" viewBox="0 0 16 16" version="1.1" width="16" height="16" aria-hidden="true"><path fill-rule="evenodd" d="M7.775 3.275a.75.75 0 001.06 1.06l1.25-1.25a2 2 0 112.83 2.83l-2.5 2.5a2 2 0 01-2.83 0 .75.75 0 00-1.06 1.06 3.5 3.5 0 004.95 0l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 00-4.95-4.95l-1.25 1.25zm-4.69 9.64a2 2 0 010-2.83l2.5-2.5a2 2 0 012.83 0 .75.75 0 001.06-1.06 3.5 3.5 0 00-4.95 0l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 004.95 4.95l1.25-1.25a.75.75 0 00-1.06-1.06l-1.25 1.25a2 2 0 01-2.83 0z"></path></svg></a>Cookies</h3>
<div class="highlight highlight-source-ruby notranslate position-relative overflow-auto" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content="Typhoeus::Request.get("www.example.com", cookiefile: "/path/to/file", cookiejar: "/path/to/file")"><pre><span class="pl-v">Typhoeus</span>::<span class="pl-v">Request</span><span class="pl-kos">.</span><span class="pl-en">get</span><span class="pl-kos">(</span><span class="pl-s">"www.example.com"</span><span class="pl-kos">,</span> <span class="pl-pds">cookiefile</span>: <span class="pl-s">"/path/to/file"</span><span class="pl-kos">,</span> <span class="pl-pds">cookiejar</span>: <span class="pl-s">"/path/to/file"</span><span class="pl-kos">)</span></pre></div>
<p dir="auto">Here, <code>cookiefile</code> is a file to read cookies from, and <code>cookiejar</code> is a file to write received cookies to.
If you just want cookies enabled, you need to pass the same filename for both options.</p>
<h3 dir="auto"><a id="user-content-other-curl-options" class="anchor" aria-hidden="true" href="#other-curl-options"><svg class="octicon octicon-link" viewBox="0 0 16 16" version="1.1" width="16" height="16" aria-hidden="true"><path fill-rule="evenodd" d="M7.775 3.275a.75.75 0 001.06 1.06l1.25-1.25a2 2 0 112.83 2.83l-2.5 2.5a2 2 0 01-2.83 0 .75.75 0 00-1.06 1.06 3.5 3.5 0 004.95 0l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 00-4.95-4.95l-1.25 1.25zm-4.69 9.64a2 2 0 010-2.83l2.5-2.5a2 2 0 012.83 0 .75.75 0 001.06-1.06 3.5 3.5 0 00-4.95 0l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 004.95 4.95l1.25-1.25a.75.75 0 00-1.06-1.06l-1.25 1.25a2 2 0 01-2.83 0z"></path></svg></a>Other CURL options</h3>
<p dir="auto">Are available and documented <a href="http://rubydoc.info/github/typhoeus/ethon/Ethon/Easy/Options" rel="nofollow">here</a></p>
<h3 dir="auto"><a id="user-content-ssl" class="anchor" aria-hidden="true" href="#ssl"><svg class="octicon octicon-link" viewBox="0 0 16 16" version="1.1" width="16" height="16" aria-hidden="true"><path fill-rule="evenodd" d="M7.775 3.275a.75.75 0 001.06 1.06l1.25-1.25a2 2 0 112.83 2.83l-2.5 2.5a2 2 0 01-2.83 0 .75.75 0 00-1.06 1.06 3.5 3.5 0 004.95 0l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 00-4.95-4.95l-1.25 1.25zm-4.69 9.64a2 2 0 010-2.83l2.5-2.5a2 2 0 012.83 0 .75.75 0 001.06-1.06 3.5 3.5 0 00-4.95 0l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 004.95 4.95l1.25-1.25a.75.75 0 00-1.06-1.06l-1.25 1.25a2 2 0 01-2.83 0z"></path></svg></a>SSL</h3>
<p dir="auto">SSL comes built in to libcurl so it’s in Typhoeus as well. If you pass in a
url with "https" it should just work assuming that you have your <a href="http://curl.haxx.se/docs/caextract.html" rel="nofollow">cert
bundle</a> in order and the server is
verifiable. You must also have libcurl built with SSL support enabled. You can
check that by doing this:</p>
<div class="snippet-clipboard-content notranslate position-relative overflow-auto" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content="curl --version"><pre class="notranslate"><code>curl --version
</code></pre></div>
<p dir="auto">Now, even if you have libcurl built with OpenSSL you may still have a messed
up cert bundle or if you’re hitting a non-verifiable SSL server then you’ll
have to disable peer verification to make SSL work. Like this:</p>
<div class="highlight highlight-source-ruby notranslate position-relative overflow-auto" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content="Typhoeus.get("https://www.example.com", ssl_verifypeer: false)"><pre><span class="pl-v">Typhoeus</span><span class="pl-kos">.</span><span class="pl-en">get</span><span class="pl-kos">(</span><span class="pl-s">"https://www.example.com"</span><span class="pl-kos">,</span> <span class="pl-pds">ssl_verifypeer</span>: <span class="pl-c1">false</span><span class="pl-kos">)</span></pre></div>
<p dir="auto">If you are getting "SSL: certificate subject name does not match target host
name" from curl (ex:- you are trying to access to b.c.host.com when the
certificate subject is *.host.com). You can disable host verification. Like
this:</p>
<div class="highlight highlight-source-ruby notranslate position-relative overflow-auto" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content="# host checking enabled
Typhoeus.get("https://www.example.com", ssl_verifyhost: 2)
# host checking disabled
Typhoeus.get("https://www.example.com", ssl_verifyhost: 0)"><pre><span class="pl-c"># host checking enabled</span>
<span class="pl-v">Typhoeus</span><span class="pl-kos">.</span><span class="pl-en">get</span><span class="pl-kos">(</span><span class="pl-s">"https://www.example.com"</span><span class="pl-kos">,</span> <span class="pl-pds">ssl_verifyhost</span>: <span class="pl-c1">2</span><span class="pl-kos">)</span>
<span class="pl-c"># host checking disabled</span>
<span class="pl-v">Typhoeus</span><span class="pl-kos">.</span><span class="pl-en">get</span><span class="pl-kos">(</span><span class="pl-s">"https://www.example.com"</span><span class="pl-kos">,</span> <span class="pl-pds">ssl_verifyhost</span>: <span class="pl-c1">0</span><span class="pl-kos">)</span></pre></div>
<h3 dir="auto"><a id="user-content-verbose-debug-output" class="anchor" aria-hidden="true" href="#verbose-debug-output"><svg class="octicon octicon-link" viewBox="0 0 16 16" version="1.1" width="16" height="16" aria-hidden="true"><path fill-rule="evenodd" d="M7.775 3.275a.75.75 0 001.06 1.06l1.25-1.25a2 2 0 112.83 2.83l-2.5 2.5a2 2 0 01-2.83 0 .75.75 0 00-1.06 1.06 3.5 3.5 0 004.95 0l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 00-4.95-4.95l-1.25 1.25zm-4.69 9.64a2 2 0 010-2.83l2.5-2.5a2 2 0 012.83 0 .75.75 0 001.06-1.06 3.5 3.5 0 00-4.95 0l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 004.95 4.95l1.25-1.25a.75.75 0 00-1.06-1.06l-1.25 1.25a2 2 0 01-2.83 0z"></path></svg></a>Verbose debug output</h3>
<p dir="auto">It’s sometimes useful to see verbose output from curl. You can enable it on a per-request basis:</p>
<div class="highlight highlight-source-ruby notranslate position-relative overflow-auto" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content="Typhoeus.get("http://example.com", verbose: true)"><pre><span class="pl-v">Typhoeus</span><span class="pl-kos">.</span><span class="pl-en">get</span><span class="pl-kos">(</span><span class="pl-s">"http://example.com"</span><span class="pl-kos">,</span> <span class="pl-pds">verbose</span>: <span class="pl-c1">true</span><span class="pl-kos">)</span></pre></div>
<p dir="auto">or globally:</p>
<div class="highlight highlight-source-ruby notranslate position-relative overflow-auto" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content="Typhoeus::Config.verbose = true"><pre><span class="pl-v">Typhoeus</span>::<span class="pl-v">Config</span><span class="pl-kos">.</span><span class="pl-en">verbose</span> <span class="pl-c1">=</span> <span class="pl-c1">true</span></pre></div>
<p dir="auto">Just remember that libcurl prints it’s debug output to the console (to
STDERR), so you’ll need to run your scripts from the console to see it.</p>
<h3 dir="auto"><a id="user-content-default-user-agent-header" class="anchor" aria-hidden="true" href="#default-user-agent-header"><svg class="octicon octicon-link" viewBox="0 0 16 16" version="1.1" width="16" height="16" aria-hidden="true"><path fill-rule="evenodd" d="M7.775 3.275a.75.75 0 001.06 1.06l1.25-1.25a2 2 0 112.83 2.83l-2.5 2.5a2 2 0 01-2.83 0 .75.75 0 00-1.06 1.06 3.5 3.5 0 004.95 0l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 00-4.95-4.95l-1.25 1.25zm-4.69 9.64a2 2 0 010-2.83l2.5-2.5a2 2 0 012.83 0 .75.75 0 001.06-1.06 3.5 3.5 0 00-4.95 0l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 004.95 4.95l1.25-1.25a.75.75 0 00-1.06-1.06l-1.25 1.25a2 2 0 01-2.83 0z"></path></svg></a>Default User Agent Header</h3>
<p dir="auto">In many cases, all HTTP requests made by an application require the same User-Agent header set. Instead of supplying it on a per-request basis by supplying a custom header, it is possible to override it for all requests using:</p>
<div class="highlight highlight-source-ruby notranslate position-relative overflow-auto" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content="Typhoeus::Config.user_agent = "custom user agent""><pre><span class="pl-v">Typhoeus</span>::<span class="pl-v">Config</span><span class="pl-kos">.</span><span class="pl-en">user_agent</span> <span class="pl-c1">=</span> <span class="pl-s">"custom user agent"</span></pre></div>
<h3 dir="auto"><a id="user-content-running-the-specs" class="anchor" aria-hidden="true" href="#running-the-specs"><svg class="octicon octicon-link" viewBox="0 0 16 16" version="1.1" width="16" height="16" aria-hidden="true"><path fill-rule="evenodd" d="M7.775 3.275a.75.75 0 001.06 1.06l1.25-1.25a2 2 0 112.83 2.83l-2.5 2.5a2 2 0 01-2.83 0 .75.75 0 00-1.06 1.06 3.5 3.5 0 004.95 0l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 00-4.95-4.95l-1.25 1.25zm-4.69 9.64a2 2 0 010-2.83l2.5-2.5a2 2 0 012.83 0 .75.75 0 001.06-1.06 3.5 3.5 0 00-4.95 0l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 004.95 4.95l1.25-1.25a.75.75 0 00-1.06-1.06l-1.25 1.25a2 2 0 01-2.83 0z"></path></svg></a>Running the specs</h3>
<p dir="auto">Running the specs should be as easy as:</p>
<div class="snippet-clipboard-content notranslate position-relative overflow-auto" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content="bundle install
bundle exec rake"><pre class="notranslate"><code>bundle install
bundle exec rake
</code></pre></div>
<h2 dir="auto"><a id="user-content-semantic-versioning" class="anchor" aria-hidden="true" href="#semantic-versioning"><svg class="octicon octicon-link" viewBox="0 0 16 16" version="1.1" width="16" height="16" aria-hidden="true"><path fill-rule="evenodd" d="M7.775 3.275a.75.75 0 001.06 1.06l1.25-1.25a2 2 0 112.83 2.83l-2.5 2.5a2 2 0 01-2.83 0 .75.75 0 00-1.06 1.06 3.5 3.5 0 004.95 0l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 00-4.95-4.95l-1.25 1.25zm-4.69 9.64a2 2 0 010-2.83l2.5-2.5a2 2 0 012.83 0 .75.75 0 001.06-1.06 3.5 3.5 0 00-4.95 0l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 004.95 4.95l1.25-1.25a.75.75 0 00-1.06-1.06l-1.25 1.25a2 2 0 01-2.83 0z"></path></svg></a>Semantic Versioning</h2>
<p dir="auto">This project conforms to <a href="http://semver.org/" rel="nofollow">semver</a>.</p>

</div>
  <div data-view-component="true" class="Layout-sidebar">      

      <div class="BorderGrid BorderGrid--spacious" data-pjax>
        <div class="BorderGrid-row hide-sm hide-md">
          <div class="BorderGrid-cell">
            <h2 class="mb-3 h4">About</h2>

    <p class="f4 my-3">
       Typhoeus wraps libcurl in order to make fast and reliable requests.
